H0.text: Mutations that decrease the number of individuals in an ecosystem help make the ecosystem more sustainable.

H1.text: Mutations that increase the number of individuals in an ecosystem help make the ecosystem more sustainable.

H2.text: Mutations decrease the number of species in an ecosystem when they help make the ecosystem more sustainable.

H3.text: When mutations increase the number of species in an ecosystem, they help make the ecosystem more sustainable.

A4.text: Compensatory mutations are new mutations that arise and have a positive or neutral impact on a populations fitness.

A5.text: A harmful, or deleterious, mutation decreases the fitness of the organism.
